comments.body:
I think you can pass a plain Plugin, so
```ts
plugins?: Plugin | Plugins;
```
is correct?

> I think you can pass a plain Plugin

I really think you can't. 

Slate's `CorePlugin` most definitely expects a plugin array at `plugins`. Here's some pointers.
https://github.com/ianstormtaylor/slate/blob/master/packages/slate/src/plugins/core.js#L20  
https://github.com/ianstormtaylor/slate/blob/master/packages/slate/src/plugins/core.js#L200 

The «act as one plugin»-case is covered by the fact that the editor controller/component in `slate-react` accepts all properties  of a regular plugin. A case that @types/slate-react already tests. 
https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/blob/master/types/slate-react/slate-react-tests.tsx#L49-L56
Hey, you are right! Thanks for letting me know!
